message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.
• Total Liabilities are taken from the balance sheet as the sum of current liabilities. In this problem these are:
  Accounts Payable = 450,000.00 
  Taxes Payable = 287,762.05 
  Total Liabilities = 450,000.00 + 287,762.05 = 737,762.05
• Total Assets (End Amount) = 12,385,382.42
• Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets = 737,762.05 / 12,385,382.42 ≈ 0.05955, which rounds to 0.06

Step 2: Calculate the Gross Profit Margin.
• Gross Profit is given from the income statement as 1,075,241.17.
• Total Revenue = 5,755,241.17.
• Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100% = (1,075,241.17 / 5,755,241.17) × 100% ≈ 18.69%

Step 3: Calculate the Operating Cash Flow Ratio.
• Operating Cash Flow is the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities, which is –7,724,112.71.
• Total Current Liabilities from the balance sheet = 737,762.05.
• Operating Cash Flow Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Total Current Liabilities = –7,724,112.71 / 737,762.05 ≈ –10.47

Thus, the solution in JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.06",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "18.69%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-10.47"
  }
}
